definitions.definition: very complicated and detailed; carefully prepared and organized

examples.text: I had prepared a very elaborate meal.
It all turned out to be an elaborate hoax.
The ceiling was tiled in an elaborate pattern.
This elaborate deception fooled his family for ages.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent. (in the sense ‘produced by effort of labour’): from Latin elaborat- ‘worked out’, from the verb elaborare, from e- (variant of ex-) ‘out’ + labor ‘work’.
